answerText: Middle English [prompt on English][10] Troilus and Criseyde was dedicated to this contemporary of Chaucer, who is depicted firing an arrow at the world in a page set in front of his Vox Clamantis. He also wrote Confessio Amantis.
heading: NASAT |2013 | 10 | 3 | Literature | British | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: John Lydgate's Fall of Princes and William Langland's Piers Plowman were both written in this language. For 10 points each: [10] Name this language in which The Parlement of Fowles and Troilus and Criseyde were written by Geoffrey Chaucer.
